original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_Those who control their anger have great understanding; Those who_

_have a hasty temper will make mistakes. _ (Pro. 14:29)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Anger divides people. It pushes them into hasty decisions that only

cause bitterness and guilt. But anger can be a legitimate reaction to

injustice and sin. When you feel yourself getting angry, look for the

cause. Or are you reacting to a personal insult? Pray that God will

help you control a Quick temper. Pray for humility and repentance.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that You would give me a spirit of

humiliation so that I will not lose my temper over the least little

thing. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Anger divides people. It pushes them into hasty decisions that only cause bitterness and guilt. But anger can be a legitimate reaction to injustice and sin. When you feel yourself getting angry, look for the cause. Or are you reacting to a personal insult? Pray that God will help you control a Quick temper. Pray for humility and repentance.
original_verse_text: Those who control their anger have great understanding; Those who have a hasty temper will make mistakes.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with hearts burdened by the temptation of anger. Help us to be slow to anger, as Your Word instructs, and quick to seek understanding and reconciliation. Grant us the wisdom to discern the root causes of our frustrations, whether they stem from a righteous concern for justice or a selfish desire for vengeance. Lord, we ask that You would fill us with Your Spirit, empowering us to control our tongues and our actions, that we may not give the devil a foothold. May our anger be righteous, leading us to repentance and a renewed commitment to Your ways. Amen.
reflection: Anger divides people. It pushes them into hasty decisions that only cause bitterness and guilt. But anger can be a legitimate reaction to injustice and sin. When you feel yourself getting angry, look for the cause. Or are you reacting to a personal insult? Pray that God will help you control a quick temper. Pray for humility and repentance.
subject: Taming Anger, Cultivating Humility
verse_text: Those who control their anger have great understanding; Those who have a hasty temper will make mistakes.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_Those who oppress the poor insult their Maker, but those who _

_help the poor honor Him. _ (Pro. 14:31)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

God cares for the weak and the needy. In Ps. 12:5 He promises to

protect the downtrodden and confront their oppressors. We should

follow God's attitude. His works are not done until we care for the

needs of the poor.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, help me to develop a greater Christ like
attitude

in regards to the needy, I pray in Jesus name. Amen.

_ _
original_reflection_text: God cares for the weak and the needy. In Psalm 12:5 He promises to protect the downtrodden and confront their oppressors. We should follow God's attitude. His works are not done until we care for the needs of the poor.
original_verse_text: Those who oppress the poor insult their Maker, but those who help the poor honor Him.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging Your deep concern for the weak and the needy. Help us to follow Your example, to defend the cause of the poor and the oppressed, and to be Your hands and feet in this world. May we never turn a blind eye to the struggles of the vulnerable, but instead, seek to uplift and empower them, that Your kingdom may be established on earth as it is in heaven. We ask this in the name of Your Son, Jesus Christ. Amen.
reflection: God cares for the weak and the needy. In Psalm 12:5, He promises to protect the downtrodden and confront their oppressors. We should follow God's attitude. His work is not done until we care for the needs of the poor.
subject: Caring for the Weak and Needy
verse_text: Those who oppress the poor insult their Maker, but those who help the poor honor Him.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_Godliness exalts a nation, but sin is a disgrace to any people.
_(Pro. 14:34)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

(_Righteousness exalts a nation_) Here we have a reminder aimed
especially

at rulers and other public servants, that their good example is
beneficial to the

entire nation. Their sin, likewise, affects and disgraces all who
live under

their rule, My main thought here, is I wonder if other nations think
that all

citizens in this country can not be trusted because of the behavior
of the

leaders of this country?

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that other nations would not loose their
trust

in this nation because of the disgraceful behavior of our leaders. I
pray that

our leaders would be convicted by Your Holy Spirit so that they would
turn

form their sinful ways. Amen
original_reflection_text: (Righteousness exalts a nation) Here we have a reminder aimed especially at rulers and other public servants, that their good example is beneficial to the entire nation. Their sin, likewise, affects and disgraces all who live under their rule, My main thought here, is I wonder if other nations think that all citizens in this country can not be trusted because of the behavior of the leaders of this country?
original_verse_text: Godliness exalts a nation, but sin is a disgrace to any people.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging that righteousness exalts a nation, while sin brings disgrace. Lord, we pray for our leaders and public servants, that they may walk in Your ways and set an example of integrity and justice for all to see. May their righteous actions and godly character be a beacon of light, drawing the people of this nation closer to You. Forgive us when our own sin and failings have brought dishonor to Your name. Help us to be a people who seek after Your will, that our nation may be exalted in Your sight. We ask this in the precious name of Jesus. Amen.
reflection: Righteousness exalts a nation. Here, we have a reminder aimed especially at rulers and other public servants that their good example is beneficial to the entire nation. Their sin, likewise, affects and disgraces all who live under their rule. My main thought here is, I wonder if other nations think that all citizens in this country cannot be trusted because of the behavior of the leaders of this country?
subject: Righteous Leaders Exalt Nations
verse_text: Godliness exalts a nation, but sin is a disgrace to any people.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_A king rejoices in servants who know what they are doing;_

_he is angry with those who cause trouble. _(Pro. 14:35)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Now being a retired pastor, I am reminded of the times I

prayed that there were people in the church that knew what

they were doing so I could call upon them to correct people

who were causing trouble. If you don't the pastor can become

over-whelmed with the task of trying to do it all.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord give strength and wisdom to those who are trying

to build up the church, and help them to realize when the

pastor is being overwhelmed. Amen
original_reflection_text: Now being a retired pastor, I am reminded of the times I prayed that there were people in the church that knew what they were doing so I could call upon them to correct people who were causing trouble. If you don't the pastor can become overwhelmed with the task of trying to do it all.
original_verse_text: A king rejoices in servants who know what they are doing; he is angry with those who cause trouble.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks for the leaders and teachers You have placed in the church to equip the saints for the work of ministry (Ephesians 4:11-12). Grant us wisdom to discern those who are faithful and capable, that we may support them in their service and not become overburdened (Proverbs 14:35). May Your Spirit empower us to work together in unity, building up the body of Christ. In Your name we pray, Amen.
reflection: Now being a retired pastor, I am reminded of the times I prayed that there were people in the church who knew what they were doing so I could call upon them to correct people who were causing trouble. If you don't, the pastor can become overwhelmed with the task of trying to do it all.
subject: Empowered Congregation: Shared Responsibility
verse_text: A king rejoices in servants who know what they are doing; he is angry with those who cause trouble.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_A gentile answer turns away wrath, but harsh words _

_turn up anger. _(Pro. 15:1)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Have you ever tried to argue in a whisper? It is equally

hard to argue with one who insists on answering gently.

On the other hand, a rising voice and harsh words almost

always trigger an angry response. If we turn away wrath

and seek peace, we need to use gentle words.

PRAYER FOR TODAY;

Dear Heavenly Father, create in me a gentle spirit, and

patients to remain clam when approached by someone

who insists on being antagonist. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Have you ever tried to argue in a whisper? It is equally hard to argue with one who insists on answering gently. On the other hand, a rising voice and harsh words almost always trigger an angry response. If we turn away wrath and seek peace, we need to use gentle words.
original_verse_text: A gentile answer turns away wrath, but harsh words turn up anger.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You seeking Your wisdom and guidance. Help us to remember that a gentle answer turns away wrath, as Your Word in Proverbs 15:1 instructs. May our speech be seasoned with grace, as Ephesians 4:29 encourages, that we may build up and encourage one another. Grant us the self-control to respond with gentleness, even in the face of conflict, that we may be peacemakers and reflect Your love. Amen.
reflection: Have you ever tried to argue in a whisper? It is equally hard to argue with one who insists on answering gently. On the other hand, a rising voice and harsh words almost always trigger an angry response. If we turn away wrath and seek peace, we need to use gentle words.
subject: Gentle Words Conquer Anger
verse_text: A gentile answer turns away wrath, but harsh words turn up anger.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_The Lord is watching everywhere, keeping His eye on both_

_evil and good. _(Pro. 15:3)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

At times it seem like God has let evil run rampant in the world,

and we wonder if He even notices it. But God sees everything

clearly--both the evil actions and the evil intentions lying

behind them. He is not an indifferent observer. He cares and

is active in the world. Right now, His work may be unseen and

unfelt, but don't give up. One day He will wipe out evil and

punish evil doers.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You that You have Your eye on

everything and that nothing can be hidden from You. Amen.
original_reflection_text: At times it seem like God has let evil run rampant in the world, and we wonder if He even notices it. But God sees everything clearly--both the evil actions and the evil intentions lying behind them. He is not an indifferent observer. He cares and is active in the world. Right now, His work may be unseen and unfelt, but don't give up. One day He will wipe out evil and punish evil doers.
original_verse_text: The Lord is watching everywhere, keeping His eye on both evil and good.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, recognizing that Your eyes are upon all the earth and Your gaze penetrates the depths of our souls. Though evil may seem to prevail, we trust that You see all and are not indifferent to the wickedness in this world. Give us the courage to stand firm in our faith, knowing that one day You will triumph over all evil and establish Your perfect justice. Until that time, keep us steadfast in Your love, that we may be a light in the darkness. Amen.
reflection: At times, it seems like God has let evil run rampant in the world, and we wonder if He even notices it. But God sees everything clearly—both the evil actions and the evil intentions lying behind them. He is not an indifferent observer. He cares and is active in the world. Right now, His work may be unseen and unfelt, but don't give up. One day, He will wipe out evil and punish evildoers.
subject: Unseen but Not Unnoticed
verse_text: The Lord is watching everywhere, keeping His eye on both evil and good.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_The Lord hates the sacrifice of the wicked, but He delights_

_in the Prayers of the upright. _(Pro. 15:8)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

In Eccl Solomon wants us to test our faith, challenging us to

find true and lasting meaning in God alone. As you take a

hard look at your life as Solomon did his, you will see how

important serving God is over all other options. Perhaps

God is asking you to rethink your purpose and direction in

life.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, give me the strength to accept the

challenge to center my life in You alone. Amen.
original_reflection_text: In EcclesiastesSolomon wants us to test our faith, challenging us to find true and lasting meaning in God alone. As you take a hard look at your life as Solomon did his, you will see how important serving God is over all other options. Perhaps God is asking you to rethink your purpose and direction in life.
original_verse_text: The Lord hates the sacrifice of the wicked, but He delights in the Prayers of the upright.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, seeking to align our lives with Your perfect will. As we reflect on the wisdom of Solomon in Ecclesiastes, may we be reminded that the true purpose of our lives is to fear You and keep Your commandments. Forgive us for the times we have chased after fleeting pleasures and failed to prioritize our relationship with You. Empower us by Your Spirit to live with reverence and obedience, knowing that all we do will be brought into judgment. May our worship and service be pleasing in Your sight. Amen.
reflection: In EcclesiastesSolomon wants us to test our faith, challenging us to find true and lasting meaning in God alone. As you take a hard look at your life as Solomon did his, you will see how important serving God is over all other options. Perhaps God is asking you to rethink your purpose and direction in life.
subject: Discover True Meaning in God
verse_text: The Lord hates the sacrifice of the wicked, but He delights in the Prayers of the upright.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_Even the depths of Death and Destruction are known by the Lord._

_How much more does He know the human heart! _(Pro. 15:11)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Have you ever felt far from God, separated by feelings of failure

and personal problems? Remember God stands ready to hear His

people, to forgive their sins, and restore their relationship with

Him. God is waiting and listening for our confession of guilt and

our RE-commitment to obey Him. He hears us when we pour out

our needs and problems to Him and is ready to forgive us and

restore us to fellowship with Him. Don't wait to experience His

loving forgiveness. .

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, forgive me when I forget to ask that I would be restored

to a better relationship with You, when I have drifted far from You

by the busyness of this life. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Have you ever felt far from God, separated by feelings of failure and personal problems? Remember God stands ready to hear His people, to forgive their sins, and restore their relationship with Him. God is waiting and listening for our confession of guilt and our RE-commitment to obey Him. He hears us when we pour out our needs and problems to Him and is ready to forgive us and restore us to fellowship with Him. Don't wait to experience His loving forgiveness. .
original_verse_text: Even the depths of Death and Destruction are known by the Lord. How much more does He know the human heart!
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging the depths of our sin and the separation we have felt from You. Like the Psalmist, we confess our guilt and seek Your forgiveness, for we know that nothing is hidden from Your sight (Proverbs 15:11). Lord, we are grateful that You stand ready to hear our cries and restore us to fellowship with You (Psalm 32:5). Empower us to walk in obedience to Your will, that we may experience the fullness of Your love and grace. Amen.
reflection: Have you ever felt far from God, separated by feelings of failure and personal problems? Remember, God stands ready to hear His people, to forgive their sins, and restore their relationship with Him. God is waiting and listening for our confession of guilt and our recommitment to obey Him. He hears us when we pour out our needs and problems to Him and is ready to forgive us and restore us to fellowship with Him. Don't wait to experience His loving forgiveness.
subject: Restore Your Relationship with God
verse_text: Even the depths of Death and Destruction are known by the Lord. How much more does He know the human heart!

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_A glad heart makes a happy face; a broken heart crushes the_

_spirit. _(Pro. 15:13)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Wisdom is the ability to see life from God's perspective and then
will

know the best course of action to take. Most people would agree that

wisdom is a valuable asset, but how can we acquire it? Pro. 9:10

teaches that the fear of the Lord (respect and honor) is the
beginning of

wisdom. Wisdom comes from knowing and trusting God, it is not merely

the way to find God. God will lead to understanding and then sharing
this

knowledge with others.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, of all wisdom and knowledge, instill in me some of your

godly wisdom so that I might see life from Your perspective and

then be able to know the course of action to take that will be
pleasing

to You. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Wisdom is the ability to see life from God's perspective and then will know the best course of action to take. Most people would agree that wisdom is a valuable asset, but how can we acquire it? Proverbs 9:10 teaches that the fear of the Lord (respect and honor) is the beginning of wisdom. Wisdom comes from knowing and trusting God, it is not merely the way to find God. God will lead to understanding and then sharing this knowledge with others.
original_verse_text: A glad heart makes a happy face; a broken heart crushes the spirit.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before you, seeking the wisdom that only you can provide. Help us to walk in the fear of the Lord, that we may grow in understanding and discernment. Guide us to see life through your eyes, that we may know the best course of action to take. May your wisdom be the foundation of our lives, that we may share your knowledge with others and bring glory to your name. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: Wisdom is the ability to see life from God's perspective, and then will know the best course of action to take. Most people would agree that wisdom is a valuable asset, but how can we acquire it? Proverbs 9:10 teaches that the fear of the Lord (respect and honor) is the beginning of wisdom. Wisdom comes from knowing and trusting God; it is not merely the way to find God. God will lead to understanding and then sharing this knowledge with others.
subject: Seek Wisdom from the Lord
verse_text: A glad heart makes a happy face; a broken heart crushes the spirit.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_A wise person is hungry for truth, while the fool feeds on trash._

(Pro. 15:14)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

What we feed our mind is just as important as what we feed our body.

The kinds of books we read, the people we talk with, the music we

listen to, and the films we watch are all a part of our mental diet.
Be

discerning because what you feed your mind influences your total

health and well-being. Remember a strong desire to discover knowledge

is a mark of wisdom.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, I pray that Your Holy Spirit would always give me a

hunger for the truth. Forgive me when I brake from that path.

AMEN.
original_reflection_text: What we feed our mind is just as important as what we feed our body. The kinds of books we read, the people we talk with, the music we listen to, and the films we watch are all a part of our mental diet. Be discerning because what you feed your mind influences your total health and well-being. Remember a strong desire to discover knowledge is a mark of wisdom.
original_verse_text: A wise person is hungry for truth, while the fool feeds on trash.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with hearts eager to learn and grow in wisdom. Grant us a discerning spirit to carefully consider the thoughts and ideas we allow to fill our minds. May we have a strong desire to seek out knowledge that aligns with Your truth, that we may be transformed and equipped to serve You faithfully. Guide us, Lord, as we nourish our minds with that which is pure, good, and honoring to You. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: What we feed our mind is just as important as what we feed our body. The kinds of books we read, the people we talk with, the music we listen to, and the films we watch are all a part of our mental diet. Be discerning because what you feed your mind influences your total health and well-being. Remember a strong desire to discover knowledge is a mark of wisdom.
subject: Nourish Your Mind, Cultivate Wisdom
verse_text: A wise person is hungry for truth, while the fool feeds on trash.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_For the poor, every day brings trouble, for the happy heart,_

_is a continual feast. _(Pro. 15;15)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

It is pretty evident that our attitude colors our whole personality.

We cannot always choose what happens to us, but we can choose

our attitude towards each situation. The secret to a happy heart is

filling our mind with thoughts that are true, pure, and with thoughts

that dwell on the good things of life. Is it time to examine your

attitude? it just may be time to make some adjustments!

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that You will always keep me alert

to any corrections I need to make in regards to my attitude. .

Amen.
original_reflection_text: It is pretty evident that our attitude colors our whole personality. We cannot always choose what happens to us, but we can choose our attitude towards each situation. The secret to a happy heart is filling our mind with thoughts that are true, pure, and with thoughts that dwell on the good things of life. Is it time to examine your attitude? it just may be time to make some adjustments!
original_verse_text: For the poor, every day brings trouble, for the happy heart, is a continual feast.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging that our attitude and the thoughts we dwell upon greatly impact our perspective and experience of life. Help us to fix our minds on what is true, noble, right, pure, lovely, and admirable, as Your servant Paul instructs. May we choose to have a cheerful heart, even in the midst of life's challenges, for a joyful heart is good medicine. Guide us to walk in a manner worthy of Your calling, that our lives may be a reflection of Your goodness. Amen.
reflection: It is pretty evident that our attitude colors our whole personality. We cannot always choose what happens to us, but we can choose our attitude towards each situation. The secret to a happy heart is filling our mind with thoughts that are true, pure, and with thoughts that dwell on the good things of life. Is it time to examine your attitude? It just may be time to make some adjustments!
subject: Cultivate a Positive Attitude
verse_text: For the poor, every day brings trouble, for the happy heart, is a continual feast.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_It is better to have little with fear for the Lord, than to_

_have great treasure with turmoil. _(Pro. 15:16)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

This statement is the key to spiritual growth and personal

fulfillment. We should honor God and center our desires

on Him ("True Religion" see Mt. 6:33), we should be

content with what God is doing in our life (see Phil.

4:11-13)

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, Forgive me for being spoiled by

the abundance of blessings that have come into my life

that makes me seek for more. Amen
original_reflection_text: This statement is the key to spiritual growth and personal fulfillment. We should honor God and center our desires on Him ("True Religion" see Matthew 6:33), we should be content with what God is doing in our life (see Philippians 4:11-13)
original_verse_text: It is better to have little with fear for the Lord, than to have great treasure with turmoil.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging that true riches are found in Your presence, not in the abundance of earthly possessions. Help us to honor You and seek Your kingdom first, trusting in Your perfect plan for our lives. Grant us the contentment that comes from resting in Your sovereign care, and fill our hearts with the peace that surpasses all understanding. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: This statement is the key to spiritual growth and personal fulfillment. We should honor God and center our desires on Him (“True Religion,” see Matthew 6:33); we should be content with what God is doing in our life (see Philippians 4:11-13).
subject: Pursue God's Desires, Not Yours
verse_text: It is better to have little with fear for the Lord, than to have great treasure with turmoil.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_A hot-head starts fights, a cool-tempered person tries_

_to stop them._ (Pro. 15:18)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

The "path of the upright" doesn't always seem easy (15:19)

but look at the alternatives. Hatred (15:17), dissension (!5:18)

and laziness (15:19), all cause problems that an upright person

does not have to face. By comparison, his or her life is a smooth,

level road because it is built on a solid foundation of love for

God,

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father I pray that You would forgive me for

not always keeping my temper in check. Amen.
original_reflection_text: The "path of the upright" doesn't always seem easy (15:19) but look at the alternatives. Hatred (15:17), dissension (!5:18) and laziness (15:19), all cause problems that an upright person does not have to face. By comparison, his or her life is a smooth, level road because it is built on a solid foundation of love for God,
original_verse_text: A hothead starts fights, a cool-tempered person tries to stop them.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging that Your ways are higher than our ways. Help us to trust in You with all our hearts and not lean on our own understanding (Proverbs 3:5-6). Grant us the wisdom to walk the path of the upright, avoiding the pitfalls of hatred, dissension, and laziness (Proverbs 15:17-19). May our lives be a testament to Your steadfast love, guiding us on the smooth and level road that leads to You. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: The “path of the upright” doesn't always seem easy (15:19), but look at the alternatives. Hatred (15:17), dissension (15:18), and laziness (15:19) all cause problems that an upright person does not have to face. By comparison, his or her life is a smooth, level road because it is built on a solid foundation of love for God.
subject: Upright Path Offers Smooth Road
verse_text: A hothead starts fights, a cool-tempered person tries to stop them.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_Plans go wrong for lack of advice; many counselors bring success._

(Pro. 15:22)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

People with tunnel vision, those who are locked into one way of
thinking,

are likely to miss the right road because they have closed their
minds to

any new options. We need the help of those who can enlarge our vision

and broadening of our perspective. We need to seek out the advise of
those

who know us and have a wealth of experience. We need a network of

advisors. We also need to open our minds to new ideas, and be willing
to

weigh their suggestions carefully.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray for Your forgiveness because I often run

ahead of You, not praying for guidance as I should, I pray this in
the

name of Jesus Christ. Amen.
original_reflection_text: People with tunnel vision, those who are locked into one way of thinking, are likely to miss the right road because they have closed their minds to any new options. We need the help of those who can enlarge our vision and broadening of our perspective. We need to seek out the advise of those who know us and have a wealth of experience. We need a network of advisors. We also need to open our minds to new ideas, and be willing to weigh their suggestions carefully.
original_verse_text: Plans go wrong for lack of advice; many counselors bring success.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You seeking Your wisdom and guidance. Help us to have open and discerning hearts, not fixed in our own ways of thinking. Grant us the humility to seek counsel from those who know us and have experience to share. May we be willing to consider new perspectives and weigh them carefully, that we may walk the path You have set before us. Lead us, Lord, that we may not miss the right road. In Your name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: People with tunnel vision, those who are locked into one way of thinking, are likely to miss the right road because they have closed their minds to any new options. We need the help of those who can enlarge our vision and broaden our perspective. We need to seek out the advice of those who know us and have a wealth of experience. We need a network of advisors. We also need to open our minds to new ideas and be willing to weigh their suggestions carefully.
subject: Expand Your Perspective
verse_text: Plans go wrong for lack of advice; many counselors bring success.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_The Lord destroys the house of the proud, but He protects the_

_property of widows. _(Pro. 15:25)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

God's plans frustrates the "plans of the wicked" because His

values are the opposite of society's. Jesus turned society's

values upside down when He proclaimed that "many who seem

to be important now will be the least important then, and those

who are considered least here will be the greatest then"

(Mt. 19:30). We should not be surprised when others don't

understand our Christian values; but let us not give into theirs.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, Help me to be more patient when

explaining our Christian values. Amen.
original_reflection_text: God's plans frustrates the "plans of the wicked" because His values are the opposite of society's. Jesus turned society's values upside down when He proclaimed that "many who seem to be important now will be the least important then, and those who are considered least here will be the greatest then" (Matthew 19:30). We should not be surprised when others don't understand our Christian values; but let us not give into theirs.
original_verse_text: The Lord destroys the house of the proud, but He protects the property of widows.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we acknowledge that Your wisdom and understanding are far greater than our own. Your ways are not our ways, and Your thoughts are not our thoughts. We confess that we often succumb to the temptation of following the world's values, which are in opposition to Your righteous ways. Lord, grant us the courage to stand firm in our faith, even when it means going against the grain of society. Help us to seek Your will and not our own, for we know that Your plans will prevail, and the schemes of the wicked will be frustrated. We trust in Your sovereign power and unfailing love. Amen.
reflection: God's plans frustrates the “plans of the wicked” because His values are the opposite of society's. Jesus turned society's values upside down when He proclaimed that “many who seem to be important now will be the least important then, and those who are considered least here will be the greatest then” (Matthew 19:30). We should not be surprised when others don't understand our Christian values; but let us not give into theirs.
subject: Upending Society's Upside-Down Values
verse_text: The Lord destroys the house of the proud, but He protects the property of widows.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_The godly think before speaking; The wicked spout evil words._

(Pro. 15:28)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Some Christians believe that faith is a personal matter that should

be kept to oneself. It is true that we shouldn't be boisterous or

obnoxious in sharing our faith, but we should always be ready to

give an answer, gently and respectfully, when asked about our

faith, our life style, or our Christian perspective. Can others see

your faith in Christ? Are you prepared to tell them what Christ

has done in your life?

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that I will always let my faith in

You shine through my life by the help of Your Holy Spirit. .

Amen.
original_reflection_text: Some Christians believe that faith is a personal matter that should be kept to oneself. It is true that we shouldn't be boisterous or obnoxious in sharing our faith, but we should always be ready to give an answer, gently and respectfully, when asked about our faith, our life style, or our Christian perspective. Can others see your faith in Christ? Are you prepared to tell them what Christ has done in your life?
original_verse_text: The godly think before speaking; The wicked spout evil words.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks for the gift of Your Word and the wisdom it imparts. Help us to speak the truth in love, always ready to give a reason for the hope that we have in You. May our lives reflect the transformative power of Your Son, Jesus Christ, that others may see Your light shining through us. Grant us the courage and discernment to share our faith humbly and graciously, that Your name may be glorified. Amen.
reflection: Some Christians believe that faith is a personal matter that should be kept to oneself. It is true that we shouldn't be boisterous or obnoxious in sharing our faith, but we should always be ready to give an answer, gently and respectfully, when asked about our faith, our lifestyle, or our Christian perspective. Can others see your faith in Christ? Are you prepared to tell them what Christ has done in your life?
subject: Reveal Your Faith in Christ
verse_text: The godly think before speaking; The wicked spout evil words.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_The Lord is far from the wicked, BUT He hears the prayers_

_of the righteous. _(Pro. 15:29)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

The Lord is close to those who all upon Him, that is to everyone who calls upon Him sincerely. He hears their cries for

help and He rescue them.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Once again Dear Lord, I thank You for the promise to hear

All who sincerely call upon You for help. Amen.
original_reflection_text: The Lord is close to those who all upon Him, that is to everyone who calls upon Him sincerely. He hears their cries for help and He rescue them.
original_verse_text: The Lord is far from the wicked, BUT He hears the prayers of the righteous.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we praise You for Your nearness to all who call upon You in truth. You hear the cries of Your children and are swift to deliver them from their troubles. Help us to draw near to You with sincere hearts, trusting in Your unfailing love and compassion. May we ever seek Your presence, knowing that You are close to all who seek You. Amen.
reflection: The Lord is close to those who call upon Him, that is to everyone who calls upon Him sincerely. He hears their cries for help and He rescues them.
subject: Cries for Help Answered
verse_text: The Lord is far from the wicked, BUT He hears the prayers of the righteous.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_We can gather our thoughts, but the Lord gives the _

_right answer. _(Pro. 16:1)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

This verse can be understood to mean that the final outcome

of our plans that we make are in god's hands. So then the question

is WHY MAKE PLANS? Well in doing God's will, there must be a

partnership between our efforts and God's control. He wants us

to use our minds, to seek the advice of others, in our plans. As

you live for Him, ask for guidance as you plan, and then act on

your plans you need trust in Him.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, it is my tendency to run out ahead of

You, please forgive me for this fault. Amen.
original_reflection_text: This verse can be understood to mean that the final outcome of our plans that we make are in god's hands. So then the question is WHY MAKE PLANS? Well in doing God's will, there must be a partnership between our efforts and God's control. He wants us to use our minds, to seek the advice of others, in our plans. As you live for Him, ask for guidance as you plan, and then act on your plans you need trust in Him.
original_verse_text: We can gather our thoughts, but the Lord gives the right answer.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging that our plans and intentions are ultimately in Your hands. Help us to seek Your will and guidance as we make decisions and chart the course of our lives. Grant us the wisdom to plan diligently, yet the faith to trust in Your sovereign control. May our efforts be aligned with Your purpose, and may we find peace in the knowledge that Your ways are higher than our own. We surrender our plans to You, Lord, and pray that Your will be done. Amen.
reflection: This verse can be understood to mean that the final outcome of our plans that we make are in God's hands. So then the question is, “Why make plans?” Well, in doing God's will, there must be a partnership between our efforts and God's control. He wants us to use our minds, to seek the advice of others, in our plans. As you live for Him, ask for guidance as you plan, and then act on your plans; you need to trust in Him.
subject: Trusting God's Plan for Your Life
verse_text: We can gather our thoughts, but the Lord gives the right answer.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_People may be pure in their own eyes, but the Lord examines _

_their motive. _(Pro. 16:20

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

People can rationalize anything if they have no standards for

judging right and wrong. We can always prove that we are

right. But before putting any plan into action, we should ask

our selves these three questions: (1) Is this plan in harmony

with God's truth? (2) will it work under real life conditions?

(3) Is my attitude pleasing to God?

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, once again your Word has cause me

to question my actions and motives while making new plans

for my life. I pray that I would be sensitive to Your Holy

Spirit's guidance. Amen.
original_reflection_text: People can rationalize anything if they have no standards for judging right and wrong. We can always prove that we are right. But before putting any plan into action, we should ask our selves these three questions: (1) Is this plan in harmony with God's truth? (2) will it work under real life conditions? (3) Is my attitude pleasing to God?
original_verse_text: People may be pure in their own eyes, but the Lord examines their motive.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, acknowledging that our own understanding can so easily lead us astray. Grant us the wisdom to discern Your truth, to test our plans against the realities of life, and to maintain an attitude that is pleasing in Your sight. May we not lean on our own understanding, but trust in You with all our hearts. Guide us, Lord, that we may walk the path of righteousness, for Your glory. Amen.
reflection: People can rationalize anything if they have no standards for judging right and wrong. We can always prove that we are right. But before putting any plan into action, we should ask ourselves these three questions: (1) Is this plan in harmony with God's truth? (2) Will it work under real-life conditions? (3) Is my attitude pleasing to God?
subject: Discern God's Truth Before Acting
verse_text: People may be pure in their own eyes, but the Lord examines their motive.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_Commit your work to the Lord, and then your plans will succeed._

(Pro. 16:3)

Thought for Today:
We must maintain a delicate balance: trusting God as if everything

depended upon Him, while working as if everything depended upon

us. Think of a specific effort in which you are involved right now.

Have you committed it to the Lord?

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, help me put (Pro. 16:3) to memory. Amen.
original_reflection_text: We must maintain a delicate balance: trusting God as if everything depended upon Him, while working as if everything depended upon us. Think of a specific effort in which you are involved right now. Have you committed it to the Lord?
original_verse_text: Commit your work to the Lord, and then your plans will succeed.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging that our efforts are futile without Your guidance and provision. Help us to trust in You completely, casting our cares and concerns upon You, as Your Word instructs in Philippians 4:6-7. May we work diligently, yet surrender the outcomes to Your sovereign will, as Proverbs 16:3 reminds us. Grant us the wisdom to discern Your leading and the courage to follow where You direct. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: We must maintain a delicate balance: trusting God as if everything depended upon Him, while working as if everything depended upon us. Think of a specific effort in which you are involved right now. Have you committed it to the Lord?
subject: Trusting God, Doing Our Part
verse_text: Commit your work to the Lord, and then your plans will succeed.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_The Lord has made everything for His own purposes, even the_

_wicked for punishment. _(Pro. 16:4)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

This verse doesn't mean that God created some people to be wicked,

but God uses even the activities of wicked people for His good
purposes

(Gen. 50:20). God is infinite, and we are finite. No matter how great

our intellects, we will never be able to understand Him completely.

But we can accept by faith that He is all powerful, all-loving, and

perfectly good_ _(Jm. 1:13, 17); and we can trust that that there are

no loose ends in His system of judgment. Evil is a temporary
condition

in the universe. One Day God will destroy it.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for Your all powerful-all-loving-perfectly good character. Amen.
original_reflection_text: This verse doesn't mean that God created some people to be wicked, but God uses even the activities of wicked people for His good purposes (Genesis 50:20). God is infinite, and we are finite. No matter how great our intellects, we will never be able to understand Him completely. But we can accept by faith that He is all powerful, all-loving, and perfectly good (James 1:13, 17); and we can trust that there are no loose ends in His system of judgment. Evil is a temporary condition in the universe. One Day God will destroy it.
original_verse_text: The Lord has made everything for His own purposes, even the wicked for punishment.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we praise You for Your perfect righteousness and justice. Though we cannot fully comprehend Your ways, we trust that You work all things according to the counsel of Your will, even using the wicked for Your good purposes. Help us to rest in Your sovereign control, knowing that one day You will destroy all evil and establish Your eternal kingdom. In Your Son's name we pray, Amen.
reflection: This verse doesn't mean that God created some people to be wicked, but God uses even the activities of wicked people for His good purposes (Genesis 50:20). God is infinite, and we are finite. No matter how great our intellects, we will never be able to understand Him completely. But we can accept by faith that He is all-powerful, all-loving, and perfectly good (James 1:13, 17); and we can trust that there are no loose ends in His system of judgment. Evil is a temporary condition in the universe. One day God will destroy it.
subject: God's Sovereign Purposes Unfold
verse_text: The Lord has made everything for His own purposes, even the wicked for punishment.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_The Lord despises pride; be assured that the proud will_

_be punished. _(Pro. 16:5)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Pride is our inner voice that whispers, "MY way is best." It is

resisting God's leadership and believing that you are able to

live without His help. When ever you find yourself wanting to

do it your way or looking down on other people, you are being

controlled by pride. Only when you eliminate pride can God

help you become all that you were meant to be.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that I will allow Your Holy Spirit

to always direct my thinking, so that pride will not be able to

control my thinking. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Pride is our inner voice that whispers, "MY way is best. " It is resisting God's leadership and believing that you are able to live without His help. When ever you find yourself wanting to do it your way or looking down on other people, you are being controlled by pride. Only when you eliminate pride can God help you become all that you were meant to be.
original_verse_text: The Lord despises pride; be assured that the proud will be punished.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging the danger of pride that so easily entangles us. Help us to see our need for Your guidance and to resist the temptation to rely on our own understanding. May we not be exalted by our own strength, but find true fulfillment in submitting to Your will. Humble us, Lord, that we may be lifted up by Your grace. We pray this in the name of Jesus Christ, our Savior. Amen.
reflection: Pride is our inner voice that whispers, “My way is best.” It is resisting God's leadership and believing that you are able to live without His help. Whenever you find yourself wanting to do it your way or looking down on other people, you are being controlled by pride. Only when you eliminate pride can God help you become all that you were meant to be.
subject: Eliminate Pride, Embrace God's Way
verse_text: The Lord despises pride; be assured that the proud will be punished.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_When the ways of the people please the Lord, He makes even_

_their enemies live at peace. _(Pro. 16:7)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

We want other people to like us, SO, let us bloom where we are
planted.

Our effort to be peace makers will usually make us more attractive to

those around us, even our enemies. But even if it doesn't, we haven't

lost anything. We are still pleasing God, the only One who truly
matters.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that my actions will be pleasing to You,
but

I am only human, so I pray You will forgive me when my actions are
not

pleasing to You. Amen.
original_reflection_text: We want other people to like us, SO, let us bloom where we are planted. Our effort to be peace makers will usually make us more attractive to those around us, even our enemies. But even if it doesn't, we haven't lost anything. We are still pleasing God, the only One who truly matters.
original_verse_text: When the ways of the people please the Lord, He makes even their enemies live at peace.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, seeking to walk in a manner worthy of the calling to which we have been called. Grant us the grace to be patient and gentle with one another, bearing with one another in love, and making every effort to maintain the unity of the Spirit in the bond of peace. May our desire to be peacemakers and to bloom where You have planted us be pleasing to You, the only One whose opinion truly matters. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: We want other people to like us, so, let us bloom where we are planted. Our effort to be peacemakers will usually make us more attractive to those around us, even our enemies. But even if it doesn't, we haven't lost anything. We are still pleasing God, the only One who truly matters.
subject: Bloom Where Planted
verse_text: When the ways of the people please the Lord, He makes even their enemies live at peace.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_We can make our plans, but God determines our steps._ (Pro. 16:9)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

We need to remember, God's ability to direct our life is fare

superior to our ability. I believe that there are times that we

are afraid of God's power and plans because we know that

His power could easily crush us if He chose to use it against

us. But don't be afraid to let God correct your plans. He will

give you wisdom if you are willing.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, again I have to confess that I am guilty

of not always being obedient in allowing You to direct my path

because of my impatience. I ask You to please forgive me. Amen.
original_reflection_text: We need to remember, God's ability to direct our life is fare superior to our ability. I believe that there are times that we are afraid of God's power and plans because we know that His power could easily crush us if He chose to use it against us. But don't be afraid to let God correct your plans. He will give you wisdom if you are willing.
original_verse_text: We can make our plans, but God determines our steps.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging that our plans and ways are not as wise as Yours. Help us to trust in You with all our hearts and not rely on our own understanding. Guide our steps, Lord, and direct our paths according to Your perfect will. Grant us the wisdom to submit to Your sovereign authority, for we know that Your plans for us are good. May we walk in faith, not in fear, as we follow where You lead. Amen.
reflection: We need to remember, God's ability to direct our life is far superior to our ability. I believe that there are times that we are afraid of God's power and plans because we know that His power could easily crush us if He chose to use it against us. But don't be afraid to let God correct your plans. He will give you wisdom if you are willing.
subject: Embrace God's Superior Guidance
verse_text: We can make our plans, but God determines our steps.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_The Lord demands fairness in every business deal; HE_

_sets the standard. _(Pro. 16:11)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Yes the Lord hates cheating, (Pro. 11:1) We should be generous

in our giving. (Pro. 22:9) We should place people's needs ahead

of profit. (Pro 11:6) We should be aware of the needs of the poor

(Pro. 21:13).

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that You will forgive me for falling

short of Your expectations of what You expect in my life. I pray

that I will be more sensitive of Your Holy Spirit's leading. .
Amen.
original_reflection_text: Yes the Lord hates cheating, (Proverbs 11:1) We should be generous in our giving. (Proverbs 22:9) We should place people's needs ahead of profit. (Proverbs 11:6) We should be aware of the needs of the poor (Proverbs 21:13).
original_verse_text: The Lord demands fairness in every business deal; HE sets the standard.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging that You hate all forms of dishonesty and deceit. Help us to be generous and compassionate, placing the needs of others before our own desires for profit. May we be keenly aware of the plight of the poor and the marginalized, and may our actions reflect Your love and concern for all people. Guide us to walk in Your ways of righteousness and justice. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: Yes, the Lord hates cheating (Proverbs 11:1). We should be generous in our giving (Proverbs 22:9). We should place people's needs ahead of profit (Proverbs 11:6). We should be aware of the needs of the poor (Proverbs 21:13).
subject: Generous Giving Pleases the Lord
verse_text: The Lord demands fairness in every business deal; HE sets the standard.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_A king despises wrongdoing; _(Pro. 16:12)

_The king is pleased with righteous lips; _Vs. 13

_The anger of the king is a deadly threat; _Vs. 14

_When the king smiles, there is life; _Vs. 15

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

In Acts 24:45-47 Jesus asks us to spend the time of waiting taking
care

of His people and doing His work here on earth, both within the
church

and outside it. This is the best way to prepare for Christ's return.
Let

this be our endeavor each and every day of our life. Including being
an

obedient citizen.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, Help me to live a more Christ like life each day. .
Amen.
original_reflection_text: In Acts 24:45-47 Jesus asks us to spend the time of waiting taking care of His people and doing His work here on earth, both within the church and outside it. This is the best way to prepare for Christ's return. Let this be our endeavor each and every day of our life. Including being an obedient citizen.
original_verse_text: 12 Kings detest wrongdoing, for a throne is established through righteousness. 13 Kings take pleasure in honest lips; they value the one who speaks what is right. 14 A king’s wrath is a messenger of death, but a wise man will appease it.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging that our times are in Your hands. As we await the fulfillment of Your promises, grant us wisdom and discernment to govern with justice and righteousness, as You have instructed in Your Word. May we be diligent in caring for Your people and doing the work You have set before us, that we may be found faithful when You return. Guide us by Your Holy Spirit, that we may be empowered to be Your witnesses in all the world. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: In Acts 24:25-27, Jesus asks us to spend the time of waiting taking care of His people and doing His work here on earth, both within the church and outside it. This is the best way to prepare for Christ's return. Let this be our endeavor each and every day of our life, including being an obedient citizen.
subject: Prepare for Christ's Return
verse_text: 12 Kings detest wrongdoing, for a throne is established through righteousness. 13 Kings take pleasure in honest lips; they value the one who speaks what is right. 14 A king’s wrath is a messenger of death, but a wise man will appease it.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_How much better to get wisdom than gold, AND understanding_

_than sliver! _(Pro. 16:16)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

God helps us on the way to wisdom; OUR RESPONSE SHOULD BE:

to fear and reverence God, To obey God's Word, to please God,

and to trust in God. .

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, Forgive me for not always, reverencing You as I should

or obey Your Word as I should NOR always trust You as I should

Amen.
original_reflection_text: God helps us on the way to wisdom; OUR RESPONSE SHOULD BE: to fear and reverence God, To obey God's Word, to please God, and to trust in God. .
original_verse_text: How much better to get wisdom than gold, AND understanding than sliver!
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, seeking the wisdom that comes from fearing and revering You. Help us to walk in obedience to Your Word, that we may please You and trust in Your guidance. May the knowledge of You be the beginning of our understanding, as we strive to live according to Your will. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: God helps us on the way to wisdom. Our response should be: to fear and reverence God, to obey God's Word, to please God, and to trust in God.
subject: Wisdom's Path: Fear, Obey, Please
verse_text: How much better to get wisdom than gold, AND understanding than sliver!

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_Pride goes before destruction, and haughtiness before the fall._

(Pro. 16:18)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Proud people take little account of their weakness and do not

anticipate stumbling blocks. They think they are above frailties

of common people. In this state of mind they are easily tripped

up. It is important that we keep our pride in check. so we should

ask someone we trust whether self satisfaction has blinded you

to warning signs. He or she may help you avoid a fall.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, I pray that I would listen to the warnings of those I

have always trusted so that I will not fall into the trap of self

pride. I pray this in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Proud people take little account of their weakness and do not anticipate stumbling blocks. They think they are above frailties of common people. In this state of mind they are easily tripped up. It is important that we keep our pride in check. so we should ask someone we trust whether self satisfaction has blinded you to warning signs. He or she may help you avoid a fall.
original_verse_text: Pride goes before destruction, and haughtiness before the fall.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging the dangers of pride and self-exaltation. Help us to see ourselves rightly, not to be blinded by self-satisfaction or a false sense of superiority. Grant us the wisdom to heed the warnings of those who care for us, that we may avoid the pitfalls of arrogance and walk in Your ways. May we ever seek to glorify You, not ourselves. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: Proud people take little account of their weakness and do not anticipate stumbling blocks. They think they are above frailties of common people. In this state of mind they are easily tripped up. It is important that we keep our pride in check. so we should ask someone we trust whether self satisfaction has blinded you to warning signs. He or she may help you avoid a fall.
subject: Avoid Pride's Blinding Effect
verse_text: Pride goes before destruction, and haughtiness before the fall.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_Those who listen to instruction will prosper; those _

_who trust the Lord will be happy. _(Pro. 16:20)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

We must surrender fully and submit to the Son. Christ is

not only God's chosen King, He is the rightful King of

our hearts and lives. To be ready for His second coming,

we must submit to His leadership every day.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Oh Lord, forgive me when I become lax in the preparation

for Christ's second coming. Amen.

(You may be receiving two of these devo. for Monday

because the first one disappeared on it's own.)

Have a good day!
original_reflection_text: We must surrender fully and submit to the Son. Christ is not only God's chosen King, He is the rightful King of our hearts and lives. To be ready for His second coming, we must submit to His leadership every day.
original_verse_text: Those who listen to instruction will prosper; those who trust the Lord will be happy.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging that Christ is the rightful King of our lives. Help us to surrender fully and submit to Your Son, that we may find refuge in Him and be ready for His glorious return. May we walk in the wisdom of Your Word, taking refuge in the Son, lest we perish in our own ways. We pray this in the precious name of Jesus Christ, our Lord and Savior. Amen.
reflection: We must surrender fully and submit to the Son. Christ is not only God's chosen King, He is the rightful King of our hearts and lives. To be ready for His second coming, we must submit to His leadership every day.
subject: Surrender Fully to the Son
verse_text: Those who listen to instruction will prosper; those who trust the Lord will be happy.

original_content:
VERSE OR TODAY:

_Discretion is a life-giving fountain to those who possess it,_

_but discipline is wasted on fools. _(Pro. 16:22)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

For centuries people sought a fountain of youth, a spring that

promised to give eternal life and vitality. It was never found.

But God's wisdom is a LIFE-GIVING fountain that can make a

person happy, healthy, and alive forever. HOW? When we live

by God's Word, He washes away the deadly effects of sin

(see Titus 3:4-8). Here we see the hope of eternal a life with

Him that gives us a joyful perspective on our present life.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for Your life giving wisdom

that we find in Your Word, which gives us the hope of eternal

life with You. Amen.
original_reflection_text: For centuries people sought a fountain of youth, a spring that promised to give eternal life and vitality. It was never found. But God's wisdom is a LIFE-GIVING fountain that can make a person happy, healthy, and alive forever. HOW? When we live by God's Word, He washes away the deadly effects of sin (see Titus 3:4-8). Here we see the hope of eternal a life with Him that gives us a joyful perspective on our present life.
original_verse_text: Discretion is a life-giving fountain to those who possess it, but discipline is wasted on fools.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks for the life-giving fountain of Your wisdom found in Your Word. May we drink deeply from this well of understanding, that it may be a source of life and vitality to our souls. Cleanse us from the deadly effects of sin, and fill us with the hope of eternal life with You, that we may have a joyful perspective on our present circumstances. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: For centuries, people sought a fountain of youth, a spring that promised to give eternal life and vitality. It was never found. But God's wisdom is a life-giving fountain that can make a person happy, healthy, and alive forever. How? When we live by God's Word, He washes away the deadly effects of sin (see Titus 3:4-8). Here we see the hope of eternal life with Him that gives us a joyful perspective on our present life.
subject: Eternal Life-Giving Fountain
verse_text: Discretion is a life-giving fountain to those who possess it, but discipline is wasted on fools.

original_content:
DEVO. FOR TODAY:

_Gray hair is a crown of glory, it is gained by living_

_a godly life. _(Pro. 16:31)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

The Hebrews believed that a long life was a sign of

God's blessing; so, gray hair and old age were good.

While young people glory in their strength, old people

can rejoice in their years of experience and practical

wisdom. Gray hair is not a disgrace to have, it is a

crown of splendor. As you deal with older people,

treat them with respect.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, help us to remember to treat one

another with respect, old or young. Amen.
original_reflection_text: The Hebrews believed that a long life was a sign of God's blessing; so, gray hair and old age were good. While young people glory in their strength, old people can rejoice in their years of experience and practical wisdom. Gray hair is not a disgrace to have, it is a crown of splendor. As you deal with older people, treat them with respect.
original_verse_text: Gray hair is a crown of glory, it is gained by living a godly life.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks for the gift of long life and the wisdom that comes with age. May we honor and respect our elders, recognizing their crowns of splendor and the wealth of experience they have to share. Help us to value the strength and vitality of youth, as well as the dignity and insight of the aged. Guide us to walk in your ways, that we may also one day be blessed with gray hair and a life well-lived. Amen.
reflection: The Hebrews believed that a long life was a sign of God's blessing; so, gray hair and old age were good. While young people glory in their strength, old people can rejoice in their years of experience and practical wisdom. Gray hair is not a disgrace to have; it is a crown of splendor. As you deal with older people, treat them with respect.
subject: Respect the Crown of Splendor
verse_text: Gray hair is a crown of glory, it is gained by living a godly life.
